</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global</value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Stamina System </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns fatigue of given unit.  </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''getFatigue''' unit </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code> value = [[getFatigue]] [[player]];
</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code> [[if]] ([[getFatigue]] [[player]] < 0.5) [[then]] { [[player]] [[sideChat]] "I'm good to go!" };
</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]<dd class="note">
[[getFatigue]] can be applied to remote unit however it will not read the changes made to unit's fatigue with [[setFatigue]] command. Only natural changes resulting from unit moving will be counted. When applied to local unit, it will read resulting value of natural fatigue combined with artificial changes added locally by [[setFatigue]]. In short, the server wouldn't know the correct value of remote unit's fatigue if you used [[setFatigue]] on the unit prior.<br>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
